result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Ottis Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Zimmerman Consulting Inc (ZCI) testing and monitoring fees
Continue with schooling.  Obtain and maintain employment to best of abilities.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate, including cognitive thinking programming.  Comply with Family Court orders.  Cooperate with mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Engage in programming at Racine Vocational Ministry.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.
